description: Financial resilience rating based on Buffett's balance sheet strength criteria
research_basis: Weights derived from Warren Buffett's investment philosophy research (2025-10-26). Debt-to-equity weighted highest (40%) as Buffett strongly emphasizes low debt (<0.5 preferred, max 1.0) for flexibility during downturns. Current ratio second (25%) as indicator of short-term financial health (wants >1.5). Interest coverage (20%) shows debt service ability. Operating margin stability (15%) indicates earnings consistency. Sources: Buffett shareholder letters, 'Warren Buffett and the Interpretation of Financial Statements', balance sheet strength analysis.

debt_equity.description: Debt-to-equity ratio - Buffett's key balance sheet metric
debt_equity.notes: Buffett believes debt limits flexibility and agility. Companies with durable advantages need little/no long-term debt. Should be able to pay off debt in 3-4 years of earnings.

interest_coverage.description: EBIT / interest expense - ability to service debt
interest_coverage.notes: High interest coverage indicates strong debt service capacity and lower financial risk

current_ratio.description: Current assets / current liabilities - short-term liquidity
current_ratio.notes: Buffett prefers current ratio >1.5 to ensure company can meet short-term obligations

margin_stability.description: Operating margin standard deviation (5-year) - earnings consistency
margin_stability.notes: Lower standard deviation indicates more predictable earnings, important for Buffett's buy-and-hold strategy
